title: Flood of Refugees From Ukraine Mostly Are Finding Shelter in Private Homes
sub_head: An informal network of support has eased the burden on public services, but officials are wary of a backlash as the war drags on
body:
WARSAW—The living room in Taras Stetsenko’s apartment is now filled with bunk beds. The household has no space left to keep clothing. The refrigerator in the two-bedroom apartment west of Warsaw cannot hold enough food for eight relatives from Ukraine who have moved in.
“I think some more family will arrive,” said Mr. Stetsenko, 41 years old, who moved to Poland from Ukraine five years ago.
